contributor: Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). College of Arts and Sciences|Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). Technological Institute|Burnett, Allison L.|Paxton, Tom, 1937-|Horowitz, David|Strotz, Robert H. (Robert Henry)|Yannacone, Victor J., 1936-|Reisa, James Joseph, 1941-|Cole, Lamont C.|Gilbert, Lawrence I. (Lawrence Irwin), 1929-2017
creator: Northwestern Students for a Better Environment
description: The Project Survival Teach-out focused on the battle to defend the environment. The Teach-out features an assembly of environmental authorities and politically knowledgeable speakers. Part One starts with an introduction to the program, a discussion on the importance of these types of forums, and talks by Allison L. Burnett, James Reisa and Robert Strotz, dean of the College of Arts and Sciences at Northwestern University. Later, Northwestern professor Lawrence Gilbert introduces a talk by Lamont Cole. Part Six starts with the final remarks of speaker Victor Yannacone and then features a musical performance by Tom Paxton with piano accompaniment by David Horowitz. In Part Seven, Paxton and Horowitz continue their musical performance and the Teach-out concludes. This film is part of the Northwestern Students for a Better Environment records collection of the McCormick Library of Special Collections and University Archives. The collection covers the activities of a group of students and faculty at Northwestern University to gain regional and national attention in their fight against pollution.

J. (Bobby Joe), 1921-1990
creator: Northwestern Students for a Better Environment
description: The Project Survival Teach-out focused on the battle to defend the environment. The Teach-out features an assembly of environmental authorities and politically knowledgeable speakers. Part Two features talks by L.S. Slobodkin and Peter Flawn. Part Three includes talks by Barry Commoner and Paul Ehrlich. Ehrlich is introduced by B.J. Chandler, dean of the School of Education at Northwestern University. Part Four features local politicians with talks given by William Scott, Adlai Stevenson III, and Paul Simon. In Part Five, Anthony D'Amato introduces the final speaker, Victor Yannacone. This film is part of the Northwestern Students for a Better Environment records collection of the McCormick Library of Special Collections and University Archives. The collection covers the activities of a group of students and faculty at Northwestern University to gain regional and national attention in their fight against pollution.
